content:
@Rishi Gupta Just moving discussion of the issue from GitHub to here. I'm not sure if I understood correctly the first item in your proposal which is:

Possibly for non-admins, it should be: you can reply to chats from admins, but can't initiate.

  • Dost it mean that with that setting turned on the user should be able to answer messages only from chats where admin is one of the recipients?

  • Is it correct that it results in restriction for non-admins for starting PM conversations at all?

Thank you!

I think we'll need a longer discussion about this (and spam prevention in general). There are several different possible high level strategies, e.g.

  • Restrict new users from doing stuff
  • Have a "moderator" user type, and allow moderators to do things like deactivate people, delete messages, etc
